(This document is the property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.)SECRET.CP. 311(25)CABINET.HOME AFFAIRS COMMITTEE.DANGEROUS DRUGS BILL.Memorandum by the Home Secretary.I enclose herewith for the approval of the Home Affairs Committee a draft of a Dangerous Drugs Bill. The object of the Bill is to make certain amendments in the existing law so as to enable His Majesty's Government to ratify the International Convention which was concluded at Geneva last February,It is desirable that the Convention should be ratified immediately after the signature period expires on 30th September next, and if this is to be done the Bill ought to be passed through both Houses before Parliament rises.None of the provisions of the Bill are controversial and the title has been so drawn as to exclude any amendments of the existing law except such as are necessary to give effect to the Convention.W. (1) This Act may be cited as the Dangerous Drugs Act, 1925, and the Dangerous Drugs Acts, 1920 and 1923, and this Act may be cited together as the Dangerous Drugs Acts, 1920 to 1925.(2) This Act shall not extend to Northern Ireland, 25 except in so far as it amends the Dangerous Drugs Acts, 1920 and 1923, in relation to matters with respect to which the Parliament of Northern Ireland have not power to make laws.(3) This Act shall come into operation on such date 30 as His Majesty may by Order in Council appoint, and different dates may be appointed for different provisions of this Act and in relation to different countries.
